issue.title: [US-1] Account creation with email/password
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: User Authentication (user-authentication.md)
- **User Story**: US-1
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 5

## User Story
As a patient, I want to create an account with my email and password so I can securely access my medication information

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] User can register with valid email and strong password
- [ ] Email validation prevents invalid email formats
- [ ] Password strength requirements are enforced (8+ chars, mixed case, numbers, symbols)
- [ ] Duplicate email registration is prevented with clear error message
- [ ] Account creation triggers email verification process
- [ ] User receives confirmation message after successful registration

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Implement bcrypt password hashing
- Email validation using regex or validator library
- Database unique constraint on email field
- Integration with email service for verification

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Functional requirement implemented
- [ ] Unit tests passing (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Integration tests passing
- [ ] Security review completed
- [ ] HIPAA compliance validated
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] Code reviewed and approved
- [ ] Performance benchmarks met
- [ ] Accessibility requirements met
- [ ] Mobile responsive (if applicable)

## Epic
User Registration & Authentication

## Sprint
Sprint 1 (Week 1-2)

---
*This issue was generated from PRD user story. Please update sprint assignment and add any additional context as needed.*

issue.title: [US-2] Email verification system
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: User Authentication (user-authentication.md)
- **User Story**: US-2
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 3

## User Story
As a patient, I want to verify my email address so I can ensure secure account access and password recovery

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Verification email sent immediately after registration
- [ ] Email contains secure verification link with expiration
- [ ] Clicking link activates account and confirms email
- [ ] Expired links show appropriate error message
- [ ] User can request new verification email if needed
- [ ] Account remains inactive until email is verified

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Generate secure verification tokens
- Email template system for verification messages
- Token expiration handling (24-hour window)
- Database field for email verification status

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Functional requirement implemented
- [ ] Unit tests passing (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Integration tests passing
- [ ] Security review completed
- [ ] HIPAA compliance validated
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] Code reviewed and approved
- [ ] Performance benchmarks met
- [ ] Accessibility requirements met
- [ ] Mobile responsive (if applicable)

## Epic
User Registration & Authentication

## Sprint
Sprint 1 (Week 1-2)

issue.title: [US-3] Security questions setup
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: User Authentication (user-authentication.md)
- **User Story**: US-3
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 3

## User Story
As a patient, I want to set up security questions so I have an additional account recovery method

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] User can select from predefined security questions
- [ ] User must answer at least 3 security questions
- [ ] Answers are case-insensitive but validated for minimum length
- [ ] Questions and answers are stored securely (hashed)
- [ ] User can update security questions after authentication
- [ ] Security questions are required during account recovery

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Predefined question bank with diverse options
- Answer hashing for security
- Database schema for questions and answers
- Integration with account recovery flow

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Functional requirement implemented
- [ ] Unit tests passing (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Integration tests passing
- [ ] Security review completed
- [ ] HIPAA compliance validated
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] Code reviewed and approved
- [ ] Performance benchmarks met
- [ ] Accessibility requirements met
- [ ] Mobile responsive (if applicable)

## Epic
User Registration & Authentication

## Sprint
Sprint 1 (Week 1-2)

issue.title: [US-4] User login with credentials
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: User Authentication (user-authentication.md)
- **User Story**: US-4
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 5

## User Story
As a patient, I want to log in with my email and password so I can access my medication tracking dashboard

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] User can log in with verified email and correct password
- [ ] Invalid credentials show clear error message
- [ ] Account lockout after 5 failed attempts (15-minute lockout)
- [ ] Successful login redirects to dashboard
- [ ] Login session expires after 24 hours of inactivity
- [ ] Remember me option extends session to 30 days

## Technical Implementation Notes
- JWT token generation with appropriate expiration
- Rate limiting for login attempts
- Session management and token refresh
- Secure cookie handling for remember me

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Functional requirement implemented
- [ ] Unit tests passing (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Integration tests passing
- [ ] Security review completed
- [ ] HIPAA compliance validated
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] Code reviewed and approved
- [ ] Performance benchmarks met
- [ ] Accessibility requirements met
- [ ] Mobile responsive (if applicable)

## Epic
User Registration & Authentication

## Sprint
Sprint 1 (Week 1-2)

issue.title: [US-5] Multi-factor authentication
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: User Authentication (user-authentication.md)
- **User Story**: US-5
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 8

## User Story
As a patient, I want to enable multi-factor authentication so my health information is protected with additional security

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] User can enable/disable MFA in account settings
- [ ] TOTP (Time-based One-Time Password) support using authenticator apps
- [ ] QR code generation for easy authenticator app setup
- [ ] Backup codes provided during MFA setup (10 single-use codes)
- [ ] MFA required for sensitive actions (password change, data export)
- [ ] MFA bypass using backup codes when authenticator unavailable

## Technical Implementation Notes
- TOTP library integration (pyotp or similar)
- QR code generation for authenticator setup
- Secure backup code generation and storage
- MFA middleware for protected endpoints

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Functional requirement implemented
- [ ] Unit tests passing (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Integration tests passing
- [ ] Security review completed
- [ ] HIPAA compliance validated
- [ ] Documentation updated
- [ ] Code reviewed and approved
- [ ] Performance benchmarks met
- [ ] Accessibility requirements met
- [ ] Mobile responsive (if applicable)

## Epic
User Registration & Authentication

## Sprint
Sprint 1 (Week 1-2)

issue.title: [US-6] Remember me functionality
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: User Authentication (user-authentication.md)
- **User Story**: US-6
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 2

## User Story
As a patient, I want a 'remember me' option so I don't have to log in frequently on my trusted devices

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Remember me checkbox available on login form
- [ ] Extended session duration (30 days) when enabled
- [ ] User can view and revoke active sessions
- [ ] Remember me sessions automatically expire after 30 days
- [ ] Security warning when enabling remember me on public devices
- [ ] Session invalidation when password is changed

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Extended JWT token expiration handling
- Session management with device tracking
- Secure token storage in httpOnly cookies
- Session revocation mechanism

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Functional requirement implemented
- [ ] Unit tests passing (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Integration tests passing
- [ ] Security review completed
- [ ] HIPAA compliance validated
- [ ] Documentation updated

issue.title: [US-7] Password reset via email
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: User Authentication (user-authentication.md)
- **User Story**: US-7
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 5

## User Story
As a patient, I want to reset my password via email so I can regain access if I forget my credentials

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Password reset link available on login page
- [ ] User enters email address to request password reset
- [ ] Reset email sent with secure token (1-hour expiration)
- [ ] Reset link directs to secure password change form
- [ ] New password must meet strength requirements
- [ ] All active sessions invalidated after password reset

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Secure password reset token generation
- Email template for password reset
- Token validation and expiration handling
- Session invalidation on password change

issue.title: [US-8] Security question recovery
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: User Authentication (user-authentication.md)
- **User Story**: US-8
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 3

## User Story
As a patient, I want to use security questions for account recovery so I have an alternative if I can't access my email

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Security question recovery available when email is inaccessible
- [ ] User must correctly answer all 3 security questions
- [ ] Questions presented in randomized order
- [ ] Failed attempts are limited (3 attempts, then 1-hour lockout)
- [ ] Successful recovery allows password reset
- [ ] Recovery attempts are logged for security monitoring

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Security question validation logic
- Attempt limiting and lockout mechanism
- Integration with password reset flow
- Audit logging for recovery attempts

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Functional requirement implemented
- [ ] Unit tests passing (>80% coverage)

issue.title: [US-1] Scan prescription labels
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Medication Management (medication-management.md)
- **User Story**: US-1
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 8

## User Story
As a patient, I want to scan prescription labels with my phone camera so I can quickly add new medications without manual typing

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Camera access permission requested and handled gracefully
- [ ] Barcode/QR code scanning accurately extracts medication information
- [ ] OCR text recognition for prescription label text
- [ ] User can review and edit extracted information before saving
- [ ] Error handling for unreadable or damaged labels
- [ ] Support for common prescription label formats

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Camera API integration (browser/mobile)
- Barcode scanning library (ZXing or similar)
- OCR service integration (Google Vision API or Tesseract)
- Medication database lookup for validation

## Definition of Done
- [ ] Functional requirement implemented
- [ ] Unit tests passing (>80% coverage)
- [ ] Integration tests passing
- [ ] Security review completed
- [ ] HIPAA compliance validated

Medication Entry & Management

issue.title: [US-3] Medication database search
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Medication Management (medication-management.md)
- **User Story**: US-3
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 5

## User Story
As a patient, I want to search a comprehensive medication database so I can find accurate information about my medications

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Search by medication name with fuzzy matching
- [ ] Filter by medication type, brand vs generic
- [ ] Display medication details including common dosages
- [ ] Show drug interactions and warnings
- [ ] Search results ranked by relevance
- [ ] Fast search response time (<2 seconds)

## Technical Implementation Notes
- FDA Orange Book API integration
- Elasticsearch or similar for fast text search
- Drug interaction database integration
- Search result ranking algorithm

issue.body:

issue.title: [US-5] Custom dosing schedules
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Medication Management (medication-management.md)
- **User Story**: US-5
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 8

## User Story
As a patient, I want to create custom dosing schedules so I can track medications with complex timing requirements

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Flexible schedule creation (daily, weekly, monthly patterns)
- [ ] Multiple doses per day with specific times
- [ ] Every other day and custom interval schedules
- [ ] Seasonal or temporary medication schedules
- [ ] Schedule preview showing upcoming doses
- [ ] Easy schedule modification and history tracking

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Recurring schedule algorithm implementation
- Cron-like expression parsing for complex schedules
- Schedule calculation engine
- Database schema for flexible schedule storage

## Definition of Done

issue.title: [US-6] Multiple daily doses
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Medication Management (medication-management.md)
- **User Story**: US-6
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 5

## User Story
As a patient, I want to configure multiple daily doses so I can track medications taken several times per day

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Configure 1-8 doses per day with specific times
- [ ] Time picker with AM/PM or 24-hour format
- [ ] Dose spacing validation (minimum 1 hour between doses)
- [ ] Different dosage amounts for different times of day
- [ ] Visual schedule preview for the day
- [ ] Bulk time adjustment for all doses

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Time picker UI component
- Schedule validation logic
- Daily dose calculation engine
- Time zone handling for scheduling

issue.title: [US-7] As-needed medications
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Medication Management (medication-management.md)
- **User Story**: US-7
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 5

## User Story
As a patient, I want to track as-needed medications so I can log when I take PRN medications and monitor usage patterns

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Mark medications as 'as-needed' vs scheduled
- [ ] Quick logging interface for PRN medication intake
- [ ] Optional reason/symptom tracking for PRN usage
- [ ] Maximum daily/weekly limits with warnings
- [ ] Usage pattern analysis and reporting
- [ ] Easy access to PRN medications from dashboard

## Technical Implementation Notes
- PRN medication data model
- Quick-log UI components
- Usage analytics and pattern detection
- Limit validation and warning system

issue.title: [US-9] Mark doses as taken
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Medication Management (medication-management.md)
- **User Story**: US-9
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 3

## User Story
As a patient, I want to quickly mark doses as taken so I can maintain accurate medication adherence records

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] One-click dose confirmation from medication list
- [ ] Timestamp recording for when dose was marked taken
- [ ] Ability to mark dose taken early or late with time adjustment
- [ ] Visual confirmation of successful dose logging
- [ ] Undo option for accidentally marked doses
- [ ] Batch marking for multiple doses

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Optimistic UI updates for fast response
- Timestamp handling with time zone support
- Undo mechanism with time limits
- Batch operation API endpoints

issue.title: [US-10] Log missed doses
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Medication Management (medication-management.md)
- **User Story**: US-10
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 3

## User Story
As a patient, I want to log missed doses and the reason so I can track adherence issues and discuss them with my doctor

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Mark doses as missed with optional reason selection
- [ ] Predefined reasons (forgot, side effects, ran out, etc.)
- [ ] Custom reason text entry option
- [ ] Missed dose alerts after grace period (30 minutes)
- [ ] Missed dose pattern analysis and reporting
- [ ] Easy access to recently missed doses for quick logging

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Missed dose detection logic
- Reason categorization system
- Alert scheduling and delivery
- Pattern analysis algorithms

issue.title: [US-13] Track medication quantities
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Medication Management (medication-management.md)
- **User Story**: US-13
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 5

## User Story
As a patient, I want to track my medication quantities so I know when I need refills and can avoid running out

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Initial quantity entry when adding medications
- [ ] Automatic quantity reduction when doses are marked taken
- [ ] Manual quantity adjustment for pill counts or prescription changes
- [ ] Low quantity alerts (configurable threshold)
- [ ] Quantity history tracking for prescription management
- [ ] Integration with refill reminder system

issue.title: [US-14] Refill reminders
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Medication Management (medication-management.md)
- **User Story**: US-14
- **Priority**: P0 (Critical)
- **Story Points**: 5

## User Story
As a patient, I want to receive refill reminders so I never run out of important medications

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Automatic refill reminders based on quantity and usage rate
- [ ] Configurable reminder timing (7, 5, 3, 1 days before running out)
- [ ] Multiple reminder channels (app, email, SMS)
- [ ] Snooze and dismiss options for reminders
- [ ] Pharmacy information integration for easy refill requests
- [ ] Refill confirmation to stop reminder notifications

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Refill prediction algorithm based on usage patterns
- Multi-channel notification system
- Reminder scheduling and management
- Pharmacy integration APIs

issue.title: [US-1] Timely medication reminders
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Notification System (notification-system.md)
- **User Story**: US-1
- **Priority**: P1 (High)
- **Story Points**: 8

## User Story
As a patient, I want to receive timely medication reminders so I never forget to take my scheduled doses

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Notifications sent at exact scheduled times
- [ ] Multiple notification channels (push, email, SMS)
- [ ] Notification delivery reliability >95%
- [ ] Time zone support for travelers
- [ ] Customizable notification sounds and vibration patterns
- [ ] Delivery confirmation and retry logic for failed notifications

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Firebase Cloud Messaging for push notifications
- Twilio SMS integration
- Email service integration (SendGrid)
- Scheduled job processing with reliability

## Definition of Done

- [ ] Unit tests passing (>80% coverage)

issue.title: [US-2] Medication details in reminders
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Notification System (notification-system.md)
- **User Story**: US-2
- **Priority**: P1 (High)
- **Story Points**: 3

## User Story
As a patient, I want to see medication details in reminder notifications so I know exactly which medication to take

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Medication name and dosage displayed in notification
- [ ] Administration instructions (with food, etc.)
- [ ] Pill photo or description for visual identification
- [ ] Quantity to take (number of pills/tablets)

- Image handling in notifications
- Template customization system

issue.title: [US-3] Snooze reminder functionality
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Notification System (notification-system.md)
- **User Story**: US-3
- **Priority**: P1 (High)
- **Story Points**: 5

## User Story
As a patient, I want to snooze medication reminders so I can delay them when I'm temporarily unable to take my medication

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Snooze options: 5, 10, 15, 30 minutes, 1 hour
- [ ] Custom snooze time entry option
- [ ] Maximum 3 snooze attempts per reminder
- [ ] Snooze action available directly from notification
- [ ] Visual indication of snoozed medications in app
- [ ] Escalating urgency for repeatedly snoozed medications

## Technical Implementation Notes
- Notification action buttons
- Snooze scheduling and rescheduling logic
- Snooze attempt tracking
- Escalation rule engine

issue.title: [US-4] Escalating missed dose reminders
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Notification System (notification-system.md)

- **Priority**: P1 (High)

## User Story
As a patient, I want escalating reminders for missed doses so important medications don't get forgotten

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Follow-up reminders at 15, 30, 60 minutes after missed dose
- [ ] Increasing notification urgency (sound, vibration)
- [ ] Different escalation rules for critical vs routine medications
- [ ] Emergency contact notification for critical missed doses
- [ ] User can configure escalation preferences
- [ ] Smart escalation based on medication importance

issue.title: [US-6] Set quiet hours
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Notification System (notification-system.md)
- **User Story**: US-6
- **Priority**: P1 (High)
- **Story Points**: 3

## User Story
As a patient, I want to set quiet hours so I don't receive medication reminders during sleep or other inappropriate times

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Configurable quiet hours (start and end time)
- [ ] Different quiet hours for weekdays vs weekends
- [ ] Emergency medication override for critical reminders
- [ ] Quiet hour respect across all notification channels
- [ ] Notification queuing and delivery after quiet hours end
- [ ] Visual indication when notifications are suppressed

issue.title: [US-9] Low stock alerts
issue.body:
## PRD Reference
- **PRD**: Notification System (notification-system.md)
- **User Story**: US-9
- **Priority**: P1 (High)
- **Story Points**: 3

## User Story
As a patient, I want to receive alerts when my medication stock is low so I can arrange for refills before running out

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Automatic low stock detection based on usage patterns
- [ ] Configurable alert thresholds (days remaining)
- [ ] Different thresholds for different medication criticalities
- [ ] Alert frequency limits to avoid spam
- [ ] Integration with refill reminder system
- [ ] Pharmacy contact information in alerts

## Technical Implementation Notes
